PERSONAL DETAILS  
 
  
Location:   Knaresborough  
 
 
QUALIFICATIONS  
 
MEng Chemical and Process Engineering at the University of Strathclyde, Glasgow (Sept 2009 – June 
2014) Degree 2:1  
• Thesis completed on Erasmus Exchange to Graz University of Technology, Austria relating to removal of 
methanol from high grade alcoholic be verages.  
• Detailed design group project for a chemical plant to produce 100,000 tonnes of biodiesel a year.  
• Conceptual Design project on Metal Organic Frameworks (MOFs)  
 
Buckie High School (Sept 2003 – July 2009)  Advanced Highers – Mathematics [B], Physi cs [B], Chemistry [B]

CARE ER SUMMARY  
 
WHESSOE Engineering Process   
  
Candidate :  61634  
 
 
PERSONAL DETAILS  
 
  
Location:   Knaresborough  
 
 
QUALIFICATIONS  
 
MEng Chemical and Process Engineering at the University of Strathclyde, Glasgow (Sept 2009 – June 
2014) Degree 2:1  
• Thesis completed on Erasmus Exchange to Graz University of Technology, Austria relating to removal of 
methanol from high grade alcoholic be verages.  
• Detailed design group project for a chemical plant to produce 100,000 tonnes of biodiesel a year.  
• Conceptual Design project on Metal Organic Frameworks (MOFs)  
 
Buckie High School (Sept 2003 – July 2009)  Advanced Highers – Mathematics [B], Physi cs [B], Chemistry [B] 
Highers – Accounting & Finance [A], Music [B], Mathematics [A], Physics [A], Chemistry [B]  
 
 
CARE ER SUMMARY  
 
WHESSOE Engineering Process and Safety Engineer (March 2020 – present)  
• Responsible for originating and checking process philosophies and de sign calculations for cryogenic storage 
tanks and terminal ensuring compliance with UK and local legislation.  
• Responsible for originating and checking safety philosophies, specifications and layout drawings for cryogenic 
storage tanks and terminals in co mpliance with relevant codes and standards. Accountable for performing 
radiation and dispersion modelling and analysis within Phast software.  
• Liaise with all disciplines in the production of design documentation for major international clients  
• Undertak e and manage internal audits to ensure compliance with company procedures  
 
CRODA Rawcliffe Bridge (Upper Tier COMAH Site) Process Engineer (January 2018 – February 2020)   
• Leading problem solving and championing continuous improvement within the manufacturi ng plant to improve 
efficiency and enable growth including scale up of new products.  
• Active participation and scribe in Safety studies such as Hazard Studies and LOPA’s.  
• Design, install, commissioning and budgeting/cost control of improvement projects on Polymer Plant through 
CAPEX’s.  
• Production of operating instructions and procedures for new equipment and products.  
• Liaising with discipline engineers, maintenance, management and external contractors/consultants including 
insurance inspectors during  surveys.  
 
CRODA Hull Process Engineer (October 2017 – January 2018)   
• Data gathering and verification of Pressure Relief Dossiers to meet site dossier completion goal.  
• Design, install and commissioning of pump.  
• Liaising with external consultants.  
 
CRODA  Cowick Graduate Trainee - Group SHE (Sept 2016 – October 2017)   
 • Identification of improvement opportunities for Effluent Treatment Plants (ETP) around the Croda Global Group. 
• Collating, analysing and producing reports on data from 18 manufacturing site s globally to identify possible 
future sustainability and environmental corporate targets.  
• Taking the lead role for the Intelex Sustainability Performance Indicators Module Implementation for quarterly 
reporting to head office.  
• Reporting of findings th rough presentations to relevant groups such as SHE Managers, Site Directors and 
Engineering Managers.  
• Leading one topic area (Control of Contractors) for an audit on a site.  
• Participating in Process Safety discussions and undertaking testing of trial c riteria for the marking of hazard 
studies.  
 
CRODA Rawcliffe Bridge (Upper Tier COMAH Site) Graduate Trainee - Responsible Engineer for the 
Effluent Treatment Plant (October 2015 – August 2016)   
• Oversee commissionin g and completion of required documentation including supervision of contractors to 
commission the effluent scrubber.  
• Managing CAPEX improvement modifications to the effluent plant from design through to operation.  
• Solving day to day running problems as sociated with the plant.  
• Actively involved in pre implementation stages of a new oscillating baffle reactor technology arriving to site.  
 
CRODA Gouda, The Netherlands Graduate Trainee - SHE Department (Sept 2014 – Sept 2015)   
• Updating the ATEX explosion safety documents to comply with new legislation.  
• Creation of a training package (in Dutch) with test materials on ATEX.  
• Exploring Last Minute Risk Analysi

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
